message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.DS, cs.FL, cs.THEORY. 

The paper deals with the productivity of specifications of infinite streams of data, which is a topic in formal language theory and automata theory. The use of orthogonal rewrite rules suggests a connection to term rewriting and lambda calculus, which are topics in logic and computation. The focus on decidability and sufficient conditions suggests a connection to complexity theory and computability theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science), cs.PL (Programming Languages), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory), and cs.THEORY (Theoretical Computer Science).
